Belgium:
Series of strikes and disturbances in industrial areas of Wallonia
Partial legislative elections of 1886
Burma:
British "pacification" of Burma (to 1896)
Burma is proclaimed a British colony.  February: Burma is proclaimed a province of British India
Colombia:
President Rafael Nuñez creates the Colombian Constitution of 1886, which has been one of the longest lasting constitutions in the western hemisphere, and with the Reforms of 1910, 1936, 1958, 1968, 1973 and 1986 was the constitution of Colombia until 1991. The country adopts its present name: "Republic of Colombia"
on 30 March 1886, president Núñez presented his resignation to Congress due to his poor health condition caused by dysentery. José María Campo Serrano is sworn in as Acting President, becoming the first President of Colombian Republic
Cyprus: Sir Henry Ernest Bulwer became Crown commissioner.
Germany: Automobiles with gasoline-powered internal combustion engines were produced independently by Karl Benz and Gottlieb Daimler.
Ireland: 1st Home Rule Bill, also known as the Government of Ireland Bill 1886.
Philippine: Establishment of the Audiencia Territorial de Cebu.
Felix Manalo, founder of Iglesia ni Cristo is born.
Singapore: Anglo-Chinese School was established at Amoy Street.
Tanzania: An agreement is reached between Britain and Germany designating a 10-mile (16 km) wide strip of land along the coast as being controlled by Sultan Barghash bin Said, along with Zanzibar, Pemba, and Mafia. The area that is to become Tanganyika is assigned to Germany while the area to become Kenya is assigned to Britain.
